result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrie C Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment approved by his agent.
Not to serve in any fiduciary capacity for anyone.  Comply with no contact orders of his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

timeConds.notes: EMP or work release NOT allowed by the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrie C Cook

defendant.name: Cook, Jeffrie C
defendant.address: W12360 County Road P, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: from DA

I asked Judge G about not checking the boxes on the DOC Order.  He asked if there was no objection from the DA and I realized this case still had Gerald Fox as the DA and was not converted to e-filing.  So I changed the DA to Dan Diehn and converted it to e-filed.  I also emailed Arin/Dan to make sure they address this ASAP.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA submission form
from Attorney Matousek to Judge Goodman

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court, with Attorney Matousek.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead no contest to counts 1 and 5.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Felony warnings given.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Theft - Business Setting > $10,000., contrary to 943.20(1)(b) X2.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Victim G.W., president of Jackson Electric Cooperative made statement.   Victim K.B., general manager and CEO of the Jackson Electric Cooperative made statement.  Exhibit 1 marked.  June 3rd letter to Cooperative members.  Restitution has been paid in full to the district attorney.  State recommended for 5 years probation.  Concurrent.  Count 1- 1 year jail.  Count 5 -1 year jail, consecutive to Count 1.  CC.  Not to work in any occupation where he has control of the finances of another.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  D.C. made statement on behalf of the defendant.  J.H. made statement on behalf of the defendant.  D.C. made statement on behalf of the defendant.  The recommendation is a joint recommendation.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 5 years probation, concurrent.  Count 1 - 1 year jail.  No EMP or work release.  Start immediately.  Not serve in any fiduciary capacity for anyone.  Employment to be approved by his agent.  CC.  Comply with no contact orders made by his agent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Exhibit 1 received by the court.
Restitution worksheet.

Defendant appears in person with counsel John Matousek.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Information was previously filed.  Attorney Matousek states this is tentatively set for arraignment/plea & sent on July 21, for 1- 3 pm , as they are working on an agreement.  DA Fox states there will be victim statments in person and he requests 2 hours.  DA Fox doesn't object to adjourn arraignment and plea/sent to July.  Will be scheduled for July 21 from 1- 3 p.m.
Arraignment May 13, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Jeffrie C Cook in court with attorney Molly Klinge on behalf of attorney John M. Matousek.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives its formal reading. Court advised charge and potential penalties and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing and requests pretrial conference. Defendant understood. No objection from prosecution. Court found defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived time limits. Parties to contact Judge Becker's office for further scheduling. Court ordered $10,000 signature bond. Prosecution has no objection to defendant's discovery demand.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Jackson Electric Cooperative. REPORT FOR BOOKING.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Jackson Electric Cooperative. REPORT FOR BOOKING.
